title: Financials Up on Rotation Out of Tech Into Banks — Financials Roundup
text:
Shares of banks and other financial institutions rose, and the financial industry group on the Standard & Poor's 500 added to substantial gains for the year, helped by a revival in Treasury yields.

Analysts said stock traders appear to be rotating out of sectors that are priced at a premium compared with earnings, such as technology, into sectors with slower growth and lower valuations, such as financials.

The Financial Select Sector SPDR exchange-traded fund, which tracks the price of the financial components of the S&P 500, has risen more than 7% from its low on Aug. 14 when sliding Treasury yields threatened lending profits and investment returns alike. The financial sector is now roughly 3% below the all-time peak reached before the financial crisis in 2007 and retested in February of this year.

The yield on the 10-year Treasury note, the benchmark for many consumer loans, rose for a second consecutive trading session to 1.7%, one-quarter of a percentage point above the three-year low recorded last Wednesday.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 10, 2019 17:25 ET (21:25 GMT)
